availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Brock (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and private (U.S.A.). )

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Tennessee native. Father of Samuel R. Brock, Martha A. Brock, Winfield S. Brock, and Louisa Brock. Married Sarah Day Brock in Claiborne County, Tennessee on December 16, 1841. Farmer in Claiborne County, Tennessee in 1850. Married to Phebe Brock c.1860. Farmer in Union County, Tennessee in 1860. Sheriff in Union County, Tennessee in 1860. Served in 7th Tennessee Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) c1860 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Claiborne County, p. 611.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Union County, District 3, p. 437. Tennessee State Marriages, 1778-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Claiborne County Marriages, p. 133.Find A Grave, "A.J. Brook (March 4, 1813-April 27, 1905)," Memorial #8931291, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8931291 (accessed January 30, 2020). “Numerical Index to Pensions, 1860-1934,” NARA RG15, A1158_0208.KYR-0001-021-0031.
